entry.title: 'Skull of Satoshi' Artist Says He Was 'Wrong' About Bitcoin Mining
entry.summary: The “Skull of Satoshi” creator said Bitcoin's environmental impact is not “a simple black-and-white” issue” as he originally believed.

entry.title: First Citizens Bank Enters Deal With FDIC to Buy Silicon Valley Bank
entry.summary: Silicon Valley Bank's acquisition affirms First Citizens' "commitment to support the integrity of our nation's banking system," said its CEO.

entry.title: Canada’s Bankrupt ‘Crypto King’ Kidnapped, Tortured, Held for $3 Million Ransom
entry.summary: Testimony in Aiden Pleterski’s case tells a familiar story of fraud, with harrowing consequences.

entry.title: NFT Trader Accidentally Burns $129K CryptoPunk
entry.summary: Brandon Riley paid 77 Ethereum for the NFT, then irreversibly destroyed it.

entry.title: Sotheby's Pauses NFT Auction After Glitch Artist Withdraws Over Lack of Female Artists
entry.summary: The sale "will restart with a more equitable and diverse group of artists at a later date."

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Bitcoin Miami Mocked by Maxis, Bitcoiners Embrace Anti-Bitcoin Art
entry.summary: Also, Coinbase critics challenge its compliance claims, and footage of Do Kwon's arrest in Montenegro went viral.

entry.title: Painter Lee Mullican’s Pioneering 1987 Digital Art Released via Tezos NFTs
entry.summary: “LeeMullican.PCX” captures the late artist’s transition from palette knife to mouse and stylus when he was in his late 60s.

entry.title: What Are Stealth Addresses?
entry.summary: Stealth addresses offer a method of privacy similar to generating a new address for each transaction but without the hassle of manually creating those addresses each time.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Investors Rehash Bitcoin's 'Safe-Haven' Status as DeSantis Takes Aim at CBDCs
entry.summary: As investors rushed to leading cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, politicians in the United States took aim at incoming CBDC plans.

entry.title: All Centralized Firms Are Alike—But Every DAO Is Decentralized in Its Own Way
entry.summary: As new DAOs emerge left and right, figuring out how they stack up against one another is often an apples-to-oranges job for analysts.

entry.title: Bitcoin Liquidity Hits 10-Month Low Amid US Banking Crisis
entry.summary: The banking network collapse from earlier this month poses a significant risk to the health of the crypto market.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: Cathie Wood Buys the Dip on Coinbase Stock Two Days After Dumping
entry.summary: ARK invest sold Coinbase shares on Tuesday, then bought an even larger haul on Thursday after word of the SEC's warning tanked the price.

entry.title: From ‘Twin Flames’ to Tarot: Justin Aversano Exhibits ‘Smoke and Mirrors’ Photo NFTs
entry.summary: Neil Gaiman and the Winklevoss twins are among the subjects in Aversano's tarot-inspired photo set, exhibiting in Los Angeles from Saturday.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Venezuela Regulator Shuts Down Some Cryptocurrency Exchanges and Mining Farms
entry.summary: The moves come amidst an anti-corruption investigation that has brought an arrest, resignation, and a national scandal.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Arbitrum Settles Into Top 40 Coins With 81% of Airdrop Claimed
entry.summary: Most of the eligible users of the popular Ethereum scaling solution didn’t wait to claim the free Arbitrum (ARB) tokens.

entry.title: ‘Badass’: Greenpeace’s New ‘Skull of Satoshi’ Artwork Is a Hit With Bitcoin Fans
entry.summary: The Bitcoin community turned the "Skull of Satoshi" installation into a new meme while ridiculing the idea of abandoning proof-of-work.

entry.title: Tarzan Swings Into the Metaverse With Official NFT Drop
entry.summary: This new version of Tarzan is ready to leave the jungle, don some accessories, and show up across an array of Web3 game worlds.

entry.title: Ethereum Scaling Solution zkSync Launches Alpha Mainnet
entry.summary: After four years of building and multiple milestones, zkSync is finally launching its Ethereum scaling solution to the public.

entry.title: Web3 Studio Overlord Taps Dan Houser-Backed Revolving Games for NFT Game
entry.summary: Revolving Games, a studio backed by Rockstar Games co-founder Dan Houser, has partnered with Overlord for its Creepz NFT-inspired game.

entry.title: Ordinals Fees Spike as Bored Ape Yacht Club Clones Bloom on Bitcoin
entry.summary: The number of Bitcoin Ordinals has passed 550,000 as interest in digital collectibles is ignited by copies of a blue-chip NFT line.

entry.title: Mysten Labs to Buy $96 Million In Shares and Token Warrants Back From FTX
entry.summary: The startup’s offer falls just short of the failed exchange’s $102 million investment.

entry.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.

entry.title: Andreessen Horowitz Invests in Chatbot Startup Character AI
entry.summary: The emerging A.I. market, riding high on mainstream hype, is estimated to reach $196 billion in 2023.

entry.title: Blockchain Offers 'Better Repair and Care Services' for Luxury Products: LVMH CIO
entry.summary: After NFTs and the metaverse, some luxury brands are turning to blockchain technology to improve the lifecycle of their wares.

entry.title: Block Stock Dives on Short-Seller Report Claiming It 'Misled Investors'
entry.summary: Block "misled investors on key metrics, and embraced predatory offerings" to fuel its growth amid the COVID-19 pandemic, the report alleges.

entry.title: How Web3 Will Evolve the Way Businesses Connect With Customers
entry.summary: Commerce and engagement tool Dispatch is making Web3 interactions as simple and streamlined as clicking on a web ad.

entry.title: Do Kwon Arrested in Montenegro, Says Country’s Minister of Interior
entry.summary: South Korean authorities had previously issued Terra's co-founder and CEO Do Kwon an arrest warrant last September.

entry.title: Bittrex Global Offers No-Fee Trading on USDC and EUROC Markets
entry.summary: Circle stablecoins USDC and the newly-listed EUROC can now be bought and sold on Bittrex Global for no extra cost.

entry.title: Arbitrum Foundation Homepage Crashes as Users Rush to Claim ARB Tokens
entry.summary: The highly-anticipated Arbitrum airdrop has finally gone live. Amid the hype, though, the project's homepage has crashed.

entry.title: Arbitrum Transaction Activity Outpaces Ethereum Ahead of ARB Airdrop
entry.summary: Alongside transaction activity, DeFi liquidity has soared since Arbitrum announced the launch of its native ARB token.

entry.title: What Is a Wells Notice and What Does It Mean?
entry.summary: One of the most dreaded letters a crypto firm can get, a Wells notice signals that the SEC has it in its sights.

entry.title: Crypto Community Fired Up Over SEC Action Against Coinbase
entry.summary: Crypto Twitter finds a common enemy in the SEC, but some see just desserts after Coinbase delisted XRP.

entry.title: Shrapnel Preview: This Web3 Shooter Looks and Plays Like a AAA Game
entry.summary: Neon's thoughtful extraction-based first-person shooter has elements of Halo, Apex Legends, and Escape From Tarkov—and NFTs, too.

entry.title: SEC Warns Coinbase of Enforcement Over Its Staking Rewards Products
entry.summary: The SEC's crackdown on crypto staking has hit Coinbase, one month after it fined Kraken $30 million over staking.

entry.title: USDT Stablecoin Payments Launch on Telegram
entry.summary: Users can now send Tether's TRC20 to Telegram contacts.

entry.title: Tron Token Sees Selloff After SEC Files Charges Against Founder Justin Sun
entry.summary: The SEC also cited celebrities like Jake Paul, Lindsay Lohan, and Soulja Boy for pitching TRX and BTT.

entry.title: Why True Decentralization at Scale Is Hard and Rare: Gnosis Co-Founder
entry.summary: “I think it's really easy to forget about the benefits of decentralization until you need them," Friederike Ernst said. "And then it's too late.”

entry.title: SEC Charges Justin Sun, Jake Paul, Lindsay Lohan, and Others for Tron-Related Violations
entry.summary: Tron founder Justin Sun and his companies have been charged with securities violations, while celebs face charges for pumping Tron's tokens.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Mixed After Fed Continues Tightening with Quarter-Point Rate Hike
entry.summary: The U.S. central bank is balancing its fight against rising inflation with the recent turmoil in the banking sector.

entry.title: How Core Wallet is Making Crypto Self-Custody Simple
entry.summary: With Core wallet, Ava Labs is bringing self-custody wallets up to par with the most fully featured centralized exchanges.

entry.title: US Senator Ted Cruz Proposes CBDC Ban Amid Growing Republican Pushback
entry.summary: The proposed national legislation comes just days after Florida Governor Ron DeSantis offered up a similar law in his state.

entry.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris
entry.summary: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.

entry.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris
entry.summary: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.

entry.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
entry.summary: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity
entry.summary: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.

entry.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'
entry.summary: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.

entry.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past
entry.summary: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.

entry.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'
entry.summary: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."

entry.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young
entry.summary: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.

entry.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs
entry.summary: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid
entry.summary: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
